reviews.review_msg: Stay away. Gets mad when you take notes on a guest lecturer then proceeds to ask difficult and detailed exam questions about what they said. Yaps more about Taylor Swift and her political ideologies than actual course content. Final exam also expected you to have outside knowledge about current events not related to the course.

Genuinely the worst experience I've ever had with any Crim professor. We had no idea what we were being marked on, and the feedback we received genuinely gave us no insight on how to improve. Our final had nothing to do with the course content, and essentially set us up for failure.

Pam is a kind and approachable professor. It's apparent that she's passionate about what she teaches, which is nice to see. However, I would not take a course with her again. The course structure was disorganized, the grading criteria was unclear, and she was travelling so often that our lectures were on Zoom, and we had too many guest lecturers.
Someone needs to find a better side hustle...
Save yourself sometime and just do not take a class with her.

Messy professor and always unclear about expectations. "Do not panic about the prep test it will all be from the slides" and then she includes multiple questions that were never mentioned in lecture, and a question about a video we watched during a lecture when she had technical difficulties and showed it to us through her LAPTOP with no volume...
Just avoid..........
MESSIEST PROFESSOR AT SFU BY FAR. DISORGANIZED SCATTERED AND ALWAYS LATE. She postpones every lecture and is NEVER at SFU ever. Why teach a class and travel the entire time???

Pam's class could have been better this semester. Most classes were online due to her busy schedule with Innocence Canada. She seemed preoccupied/scattered, but assignments were easy and guest lectures from exonerees were moving. The final felt disconnected from class content. Overall, the class was an easy A, but it could have been more engaging.

Pam Pam Pam, why do you make students literally do your job for you?!??? Like, she literally told us at the start of the semester that she needed to redo the Innocence Canada website (for her other job) AND THEN LITERALLY MADE THAT OUR FINAL. Creativity is marked for the problems & recommendations we chose too. Like, how does that help US learn.

Pam is extremely unorganized and almost always starts class late. She encourages not to take notes because she will provide you with a summary or discuss the content in depth but she never does. Lectures are tedious as she easily gets distracted and talks about nothing for hours on end. Did not learn a single thing throughout the semester. AVOID.

Pam was very unorganized throughout the class. She moved almost every single lecture online but made the tutorials in person which was very inconvenient. Further, her final exam was not very reflective of what we have been learning throughout the year. She mainly wanted us to redo her website and do her job for her.

Final exam was absolute nonsense. I swear to god she just gets students to give her ideas so she can use it to improve her website as Director of Innocence Canada. Baffling. A three hour final that was mindnumbingly pointless to end an absolutely pointless 4 months. The guest speakers are the only thing of value in her class. AVOID.

To put it simply, the only thing that remotely teaches you anything in this class is the guest speaker lectures - anytime Pam talks it is just pointlessly asking questions of the class that we can't answer because we haven't learned anything yet and a lot of self-centered babble about herself. Terrible class. Pointless assignments. Just no.

Took 103 and she wasn't bad, the lectures were good then. 438 not so great. Due to her schedule, classes were basically mostly online which wasn't a problem, but having to travel for a 50 min tutorial was very unfair. Lectures were disorganized. Only good thing was the extensions she offered. Marks fairly easy. easy workload for upper div.

Assignments/memos are straight to the point. Her assignments allow some flexibility, incorporating practical, real-world thinking skills rather than traditional assignments. She can get distracted easily in lectures, but overall not unbearable. Passionate with students, often gives extensions. Considerably light workload for a 400-level course.

She is very unorganized, tries too hard to be quirky and cool and against the "status quo" in school but I really don't feel like I learned anything in her class. Found her irritating. But her class was pretty easy, you won't have to do an essay and you will barely have to take down notes. But you will have to sit through hours of pointlessness.

Don't be fooled by her quirkiness, she's pretty passive aggressive. The course assignments are extremely unclear, and she is very unorganized - these two traits will affect your letter grade esp. if you end up with her as a TA. She marks completely different than her  TA does, and this is based on 'creative and opinion' based assignments.

She is passionate about criminology and wrongful conviction. Lectures are not recorded. Her test is heavy on memorization. There was a lot of discussion during the lecture. She is helpful when you ask for help. Great lecturer who keeps inspiring you to think. She leaves amazing statements for you to make your own conclusions!

I wouldn't take any more classes with pam anymore. She is very unorganized, messy and all in one word, "all over the place." She takes forever to provide your grades and feedback on your assignment/tests. she doesn't play by the rules, and the whole course is creative-based. wouldn't take other courses with her again

ok so super easy class; taught about deep v heard, ted bundy, school shooters and brittney's conservatorship (dsm and all too) pam's so vv passionate and knows exactly what she's teaching, her dog comes to lecture everyday so say hi to him

Pam is so fun and so sweet. You literally can't tell she is prof cuz she treats you like yall are her friends. her lectures are so fun and she is so awesome I love her so much. However, this class is very creative meaning that her assignments require a lot of creativity and thinking so if you u r not creative dont take the class BUT SHE IS 1000/10

Pam is a great professor. One of the best in the criminology department. She understands the needs of her students and is available to help students with assignments and course materials. Pam has clear grading components and tells you what you need to know for the exam. Take every class you can with Pam.

Pamela is an amazing instructor. She is very passionate and very helpful. She is also super relatable and puts in a lot of effort to help students succeed and have an enjoyable time in the class. I would 100% take her again.
One of the best professors Ive had at SFU. Passionate about what she teaches. Shes understanding for student problems and has a very interesting lectures and assignments.

Pam is a great professor! Has a real passion for wrongful convictions and making sure students are engaged and learning. Take her classes and stay after class for office hours, she's super cool and understanding.

Throughout my undergrad, I have never had a professor who genuinely cares about their students the way Pam does. She gives thorough feedback and offers practical assignments that allow you to think critically. Amidst the pandemic, I appreciated how engaging this course was with in-class discussion and guest lecturers. She is an amazing professor!

Pam is the most caring and inspiring instructor Ive had at SFU. You can easily tell that not only does she care deeply about the topic (wrongful convictions), but she cares so much about her students too. She really goes above and beyond for her students. Her teaching style is very engaging and frequently involves current events and discussion.

Pam must be the best professor I've met at SFU so far. She really puts lots of effort into teaching to make sure you understand the material and enjoy learning. She wants students to succeed and provides an engaging class. The assignments are fun and require deep thoughts and critical analysis; which is a chance to share your thoughts!
A nice person but the creative assignment was a bit vague on the criteria.

Pam was amazing! Her lectures were very applicable to the 'real world,' she really cared about the material and made it easy & digestible for us. Lectures aren't recorded so you really need to go to lecture but lectures are actually fun! The only bad thing is that the MC portion of the final was very difficult, & she tends to go on tangents.

Pam is one of the most creative professors I have had the privilege of being taught by. Her lectures are designed in a way that relates and conforms to society currently. She is also very personable and understands the struggles that students go through. She also allows time for students to ask questions regarding exams, assignments, etc.

Pam is an incredibly caring prof. She is approachable, knowledgable, and above all, she is truly invested in the success of her students. Pam has been such a wonderful addition to the SFU staff. I hope I can take more classes with her in the future.

Pamla has been by far the most down to earth and caring prof I have ever had at SFU. She uses her own experiences as a student during her undergrad to teach better and to ensure students don't have the same miss-haps she did when she was in university. I would Strongly recommend Pamela as she is a gem that accurately relates to students today.
She literally makes learning about murderers fun and simple ahah. Loved the class :)

Pam is probably one of the best profs I have ever had. You can tell she has a passion for what she is teaching which made me excited to come to class every week. If you ever get the opportunity to take a class with Pam I highly suggest it!!

Pam is the best prof I have ever & will ever have! She is incredibly kind, caring, & reasonable. She creates an environment by how she teaches that engages with the class, which allows for the material to be understood easily, & it made the course incredibly enjoyable. She does not teach like it is simply her job but instead with true passion.

Pam is a phenomenal professor!! She enjoys the material she teaches & genuinely cares about her students, which can be seen in her conduction of the class. She made learning enjoyable & presents the material in a way that is incredibly engaging & easy to understand. She also had wrongfully convicted women come in & guest lecture which was amazing!

This class was on Women in the criminal justice system and Pam made it the coolest course ever. I'm very lucky I had her as a prof. She gives a point of view that you never would've thought of. She is insightful and so kind.

Pam is the best prof I've ever had. She gets to know her students and truly cares for them. Her assignments and response paper are fun and easier than research papers. She values students and their mental health and will happily help you if you reach out. She truly cares and I look forward to future classes she teaches.

She is great! Super chill, very approachable. So much more conversation with her than other profs Ive had. The material is interesting, and she makes learning it so much more fun. Loved the response papers, because it makes you want to pay attention to branch off on even the smallest idea from a lecture. Would definitely take with her again
Pam is a great professor! I really enjoyed her lectures and the assignments that she gave out. Gives great feedbacks.

Pam is a creative, caring and considerate professor. She teaches unique topics, so her students actually learn something new each lecture. Pam encourages her students to display critical thinking through fun and opinion-based assignments. I looked forward to her class each week because she made the lectures an experience!
